choices: to demonstrate how a paralyzed patient smiles
to examine how they were paralyzed
to show the relation between true emotions and body behaviour
to show the importance of face and mouth

question: Why does the author mention the paralyzed patients?

text: Because the musculature of the face is directly connected to the areas of the brain that process emotion, the countenance can be a window to the soul. Neurological studies even suggest that genuine emotions travel different pathways through the brain than insincere ones. If a patient paralyzed by stroke on one side of the face, for example, is asked to smile deliberately, only the mobile side of the mouth is raised. But tell that same person a funny joke, and the patient breaks into a full and spontaneous smile.
